#Text=Kuredu
#Text=Kuredu ( Kurendhoo ) is an island located in the Lhaviyani Atoll of the Maldives .
#Text=Fly
#Text=Flights into Male International Airport are standard as Passenget Boat Services are not operated .
#Text=Transfer to the Lhaviyani Atoll , being the northernmost tourist resort in the Maldives , is usually by Air Taxi ( approximately 40 minutes flight ) .
#Text=Boat transfers are sometimes available ( depending on demand ) but this is not recommended as it can take around 4-6 hours and can be very uncomfortable .
#Text=The sea between Atolls can get very rough .
#Text=Get around

#Text=The island itself is one of the larger tourist islands in the Maldives however you can still walk around the circumference of the island ( along the beach ) in anywhere between 40 minutes and an hour .
#Text=There are vehicles on the island but these are generally only used by the staff to transport heavy equipment .
#Text=Shoes are rarely necessary , even in the restaurant areas .
#Text=There is a single taxi that runs from morning to 11pm and this can be summoned from any one of the three reception areas to take you to another reception or spa .
#Text=See
#Text=Scuba Diving is the main attraction of the Island and is nothing short of World Class .
#Text=The Snorkelling is also very good , but not for the fainthearted .
#Text=There is a large variety of fish , as well as several species of shark and ray .
#Text=Diving in Kuredu is most definitely Intermediate to Advanced , as the currents can get quite strong in places .
#Text=The dive staff are extremely competent , however , and will never take you anywhere that they do not think you can handle .
#Text=Advanced divers should try the ' Kuredu Express ' dive site , as there is a very strong probability of Sharks and Manta Rays .
#Text=The current can get very strong , and visibility poorer than normal , so a negatively buoyant entry is usually required .
#Text=The ' lagoon ' area of the island ( between the beach and where the reef starts ) is home to many infant Reef Sharks and Stingrays .
#Text=Neither of these are dangerous unless you more-or-less stand on them , but they are very beautiful to behold .
#Text=The Reef Sharks in particular may come towards you , even whilst paddling at the shore edge .
#Text=Do
#Text=There is a spa located on the island offering various treatments .
#Text=Kuredu is one of the only islands in the Maldives to contain a full 9 hole golf course .
#Text=Buy
#Text=There is a shop selling a few basics ( Towels , Sun Cream , Hats , Souvenirs ) but this is very expensive , so it is advisable to ensure you bring everything you need with you .
#Text=There is also a dive shop that has a good selection of t-shirts , and some good ex-rental equipment for sale .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Food in the standard restaurant is varied and certainly does not disappoint .
#Text=Ensure you are staying All-Inclusive otherwise it is extremely expensive , though lunch is ca. 17 US-$ and dinner ca. 27 US-$ .
#Text=With All-inclusive you are not free to choose one of the four dining places .
#Text=There are A La Carte restaurants available that you ca n't use with your All-inclusive option .
#Text=Drink
#Text=You are not allowed to bring any form of alcohol in to the country , however alcohol is served in all the tourist resorts including Kuredu .
#Text=There are several bars which can get busy at night .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=Several types of accommodation are available , and most come with a private bit of beach .
#Text=Kuredu Resort & Spa , Lhaviyani Atoll , ☏ +960 662-0337 , ✉ info@kuredu.com .
